content:
ok, we're entering last call phase

  • you have 4-5 hours to make changes to the main FHIR build
  • The only changes I have left to make are normative status ones for FHIR-I (discussion in 30min time)
  • In 4-5 hours time, freeze starts, and I start working on publication QA stuff
  • @Mike Indovina I haven't heard about the status of the immunization DS IG?
  • @Brian Postlethwaite I haven't heard about the status of VHDir?

VhDir is all on R4 ready to go.
There was 1 example i wanted to get in, but it was complaining that the xml file couldn't be read as json. No idea why
Found the issue with the example, incoming update for the VhDir IG only.

VhDir complete and ready to go - Thanks Grahame
(got that last example in and working)
ok Freeze is on for the main ballot; no commits without consulting me first

well, I'm pretty much done with structural QA - I'm just trying to get my server running on the ballot version, and then i can rebuild the vocab cache. Any QA anyone can do in the next 6 hours or so would be greatly appreciated. My open issues list: pattern status, new resource status (which are draft?) and updating resourcelist.html
what specific qa tasks? typos, links? or fixing build warnings?
also wouldnt any new resource be draft by definition? (unless otherwise specifed) doesn't fhir.ini tell you?

Is an issue like a Reference on a resource that has no types declared an issue worthy of repair at this point?
http://build.fhir.org/biologicallyderivedproduct-definitions.html#BiologicallyDerivedProduct.parent
should have Reference(Any)?
(Tripped over this one updating the .net models - can work around it)
I found a few others. I'll fix them
